## Contact {-}

The VHDL Analysis and Standardization Group (VASG) is responsible for maintaining and extending the VHDL standard (IEEE 1076). The official website of the group is [eda-twiki.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi/P1076](http://www.eda-twiki.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi/P1076). Interested users can subscribe to the reflector (mailing-list) and/or read the archives: [grouper.ieee.org/groups/1076/email](http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/1076/email/thread.html). Apart from that, in December 2019, VHDL libraries were published at [opensource.ieee.org/vasg/Packages](https://opensource.ieee.org/vasg/Packages).

Although being a member of IEEE is not required, writing to the reflector or accessing ieee.org require users to register. In order to reach a wider audience, the VASG uses an organization in GitLab too: [gitlab.com/IEEE-P1076](https://gitlab.com/IEEE-P1076).

Even though not directly related to the VASG, an organization named "Open Source VHDL Group" exists in GitHub: [github.com/vhdl](https://github.com/vhdl) (find corresponding chat rooms: [gitter.im/vhdl](https://gitter.im/vhdl)).

The content of this document is being discussed in the following thread of the VASG reflector: [grouper.ieee.org/groups/1076/email/msg01286.html](https://grouper.ieee.org/groups/1076/email/msg01286.html). There is also an issue in [gitlab.com/IEEE-P1076/VHDL-Issues/-/issues/10](https://gitlab.com/IEEE-P1076/VHDL-Issues/-/issues/10). Moreover, there is a proposal in VASG's TWiki site since 2011 named "Direct Programming Interface" (see [eda-twiki.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi/P1076/DpiProposal](http://www.eda-twiki.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi/P1076/DpiProposal)). Nevertheless, interested users can participate through any of the forums referenced above.
